intro: Phyllanthus dinklagei, commonly known as the Dinklage's spurge, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring simple, opposite leaves with a rough texture. Its small yellow flowers are clustered in cyathia, a unique floral structure characteristic of the family. Phyllanthus dinklagei is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
